thread.title: Beauvine: where food and wine meets inflatable cows and chicken derbies
thread.title_full: Beauvine: where food and wine meets inflatable cows and chicken derbies

title: Beauvine: where food and wine meets inflatable cows and chicken derbies
text:
The famed cheeseburger gets special attention at Beauvine.
A meaty medley of decadence and delight hits Beaufort Street this weekend as Perth's latest food and art festival makes its debut.
A unique twist on the traditional food and wine event, Beauvine will feature a 6m inflatable cow, street artists defacing a Lamborghini and a remote control chicken derby. And that's before you hit the swanky booze and food on offer.
The team behind the Beaufort Street Festival say the three-day celebration of meat, wine, music and art at Beaufort Street's Birdwood Square is an exciting and enriching experience that complements Perth's mix of culinary offerings.
Collaborations also include a record fair curated by Leederville's Go Go Retro and a mini-market style Suitcase Rummage, plus some of Perth's best local DJs, hand-selected acoustic and live music and heaps of kid-friendly activities.
Advertisement They all provide the perfect partner to your food and wine journey through nearly 30 food, wine, beer and spirit stalls and cook-offs between various meat, pastry and sweets experts.
Entry includes free tastings, a souvenir tasting glass and access to well-respected chefs and sommeliers in one of Perth's most beautiful green spaces.
There are some seriously entertaining Masterclasses too, including a look at the 'Heroes of Margaret River' with Voyager Estate and a chance to make your own wine with help from one of WA's best winemakers Larry Cherubino at the Cherubino Blending Laboratory'.
See the full list and times of masterclasses here   
Some of the masterclasses take on a comedic aspect, such as Brewed Laughter, a beer tasting with comedian and beer expert Chris Franklin, and Uncorked Comedy, where local funny man James De Leo matches good laughs with cheese and Voyager Estate wines (no cheesy jokes though).
Exhibitors include some of WA's best wineries like Vasse Felix, Larry Cherubino, Cape Mentelle, Voyager Estate, Rockcliffe, Faber Vineyards and Woodlands plus organic producer Dormilona and Torbreck from South Australia, while breweries Feral Brewing, Gage Roads and Nail Brewing will be among those pouring beers.
Plus there'll be a special collaborative smoked meats and classic eats cook-off by the renowned kitchens of Clarences and Old Faithful. Woweee.
What:  BeauVine Festival 2015
When: October 23-25, Birdwood Square, Highgate
TIckets: www.beauvine.com.au
